meanings.definition: Occurring or produced as a consequence of something.
meanings.sent1: The resultant effect of the rain was a flooded street.
meanings.sent2: The team's victory was the resultant outcome of their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The resultant mess in the kitchen made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the resultant sound of the funny joke.
meanings.sent5: The resultant smell of fresh cookies filled the room with warmth.

meanings.definition: A force or velocity that is the sum of two or more other forces or velocities.
meanings.sent1: The boat's speed was determined by the resultant of the currents.
meanings.sent2: The resultant of the two opposing forces caused the object to move.
meanings.sent3: The resultant of the race was a tie between the two competitors.
meanings.sent4: The resultant of their collaboration was a masterpiece of art.
meanings.sent5: The resultant of the collision sent the car spinning out of control.
